criterion: Provides accurate information about the possible causes of elevated RBC counts, including minor infections, physical stress, and individual variation.
Assumes that the user has a serious medical condition and does not provide reassurance or guidance on how to manage their stress.
Provides clear and concise information about the possible causes of elevated RBC counts and offers suggestions for what to do next.
Fails to mention the importance of rechecking blood test results under different conditions.
Provides a balanced view of the possible causes of elevated RBC counts, acknowledging both minor and more serious conditions.
Does not ask the user about their symptoms or offer guidance on how to manage their stress.
Accurately describes the normal range for RBC counts and provides examples of possible causes of elevated RBC counts.
Provides a clear and reassuring message about the importance of seeking professional guidance.
Fails to provide information about the potential consequences of ignoring elevated RBC counts.
Provides a comprehensive overview of the possible causes of elevated RBC counts, including both minor and more serious conditions.
